sen.j: 川端通（かわばたどおり）は京都市の通りのひとつ。
sen.e: The Kawabata-dori Street is one of the streets of Kyoto City.
Kawabata-dori Street is one of the streets of Kyoto City.
Kawabata-dori Street is one of the streets of Kyoto City.

sen.j: 南北の通り。
sen.e: It is a north-south running street.
The street runs north and south.
The street runs north and south.

sen.j: 鴨川 (淀川水系)、高野川 (京都市)東岸を走る道路。
sen.e: It runs along the east side of the Kamo-gawa River (Yodo-gawa water system) and the Takano-gawa River.
It runs along the east side of the Kamo-gawa River (Yodo-gawa Water System) and the Takano-gawa River.
It runs along the east side of the Kamo-gawa River (Yodo-gawa Water System) and the Takano-gawa River (Kyoto City).

sen.j: 北は左京区山端で白川通と合流する。
sen.e: In the north, it merges with the Shirakawa-dori Street at Yamabana, Sakyo Ward.
In the north it merges with the Shirakawa-dori Street at Yamabana, Sakyo ward.
In the north it merges with the Shirakawa-dori Street in Yamabana, Sakyo Ward.

sen.j: 南は東山区の塩小路通との交差点までで、塩小路以南は師団街道と呼ばれる。
sen.e: In the sorth, it ends at the crossing with the Shiokoji-dori Street in Higashiyama Ward, and further south of the Shiokoji-dori Street, it is called Shidan-kaido Road.
In the south it ends at the crossing with Shiokoji-dori Street in Higashiyama Ward, and further south of the Shiokoji-dori Street it is called Shidan-kaido Road.
In the south it ends at the crossing with Shiokoji-dori Street in Higashiyama Ward, and further south of the Shiokoji-dori Street it is called Shidan-kaido Road.

sen.j: 高野橋東詰（北大路通との交差点）以北は国道367号の一部である。
sen.e: North from Takanobashi-higashizume (the crossing with the Kitaoji-dori Street), it belongs to the National Highway Route No. 367.
North from Takanobashi-higashizume (the crossing with Kitaoji-dori Street) it belongs to National Highway Route No. 367.
North from Takanobashi-higashizume (the crossing with Kitaoji-dori Street) it belongs to National Highway Route No. 367.

sen.j: 河合橋東詰（旧今出川通）から南、塩小路橋東詰まで京阪電気鉄道の京阪本線と京阪鴨東線が地下を走っている。
sen.e: North from Kawaibashi-higasizume (Old Imadegawa-dori Street) to Shiokojibashi-higashizume, the Keihan Main Line and the Keihan Oto Line of Keihan Electric Railway run underground.
North from Kawaibashi-higasizume (Old Imadegawa-dori Street) to Shiokojibashi-higashizume, the Keihan Main Line and the Keihan Oto Line of Keihan Electric Railway run underground.
South from Kawaibashi-higasizume (Old Imadegawa-dori Street) to Shiokojibashi-higashizume, the Keihan Main Line of Keihan Electric Railway and the Keihan Oto Line run underground.
sen.cmt: North→Southof Keihan Electric Railwayの位置移動

sen.j: 三条駅 (京都府)以南は京阪本線の地上線の跡地であり、1987年に京阪本線の鴨川沿いの東福寺駅 - 三条駅 (京都府)が連続立体交差されたことにより生じた土地と、並行する琵琶湖疏水の溝渠化で出来た用地を使って塩小路通まで延長されている。
sen.e: South of Sanjo Station, the street has been extended to the Shiokoji-dori Street by using the site of the old ground-based Keihan Main Line vacated through the construction of continuous muoti-level crossing of the Keihan Main Line in 1987 between the Tofukuji station and Sanjo Station (Kyoto Prefecture) along the kamogawa River, and the land produced through the construction of a culvert of Biwako Sosui (channel) which is parallel with it.

South of Sanjo Station, the street has been extended to Shiokoji-dori Street using the site of the old ground-based Keihan Main Line, which was vacated through the construction of the continuous multi-level crossing of the Keihan Main Line in 1987 between Tofukuji Station and Sanjo Station (Kyoto Prefecture) along the Kamogawa River, and the land produced through the construction of a culvert of Biwako Sosui (channel) that is parallel with it.

South of Sanjo Station (Kyoto Prefecture), the street has been extended to Shiokoji-dori Street using the site of the old ground-based Keihan Main Line, which was vacated through the construction of the continuous multi-level crossing of the Keihan Main Line in 1987 between Tofukuji Station and Sanjo Station (Kyoto Prefecture) along the Kamo-gawa River, and the land produced through the construction of a culvert of Biwako Sosui (channel) that is parallel with it.

sen.j: このように、市内中心部で開通したのが比較的新しいこともあって、河原町通と祇園の間にあるにもかかわらず、沿道に商業施設の集積が進んでいない。
sen.e: As stated above, the street opened relatively new in the center of the city so it has not attracted many commercial facilities even it is located between the Kawaramachi-dori Street and Gion.
As stated above, the street opened relatively recently in the center of the city so it hasn't attracted many commercial facilities, even though it's located between Kawaramachi-dori Street and Gion.
As stated above, the street opened relatively recently in the center of the city so it hasn't attracted many commercial facilities, even though it's located between Kawaramachi-dori Street and Gion.

sen.j: また、道路開通から浅いため、他の京都の交差点のように｢川端三条｣、｢川端四条｣、｢川端五条｣、｢川端七条｣とは呼ばず、｢三条大橋｣、｢四条大橋｣、｢五条大橋｣、｢七条大橋｣と橋の名前で呼ばれる場合が多い。
sen.e: Also because of a short history of service, its crossings are not called “Kawabata-Sanjo”, “Kawabata-Shijou”, “Kawabata Shichijou.” in the same way as those of other streets, but commonly called with the birdge names “Sanjo -ohashi”, “Shijo-ohashi”, “Gojo-ohashi”, and “Shichijo-ohashi."

Also, due to the short history of service its crossings aren't called “Kawabata-Sanjo," “Kawabata-Shijou" or “Kawabata Shichijou” in the same way as those of other streets, but instead they're commonly called by the bridge names “Sanjo -ohashi," “Shijo-ohashi," “Gojo-ohashi” and “Shichijo-ohashi."

Also, due to the short history of service its crossings are not called 'Kawabata-Sanjo,' 'Kawabata-Shijo' or 'Kawabata Shichijo' in the same way as those of other streets, but instead they are commonly called by the bridge names 'Sanjo-ohashi,' 'Shijo-ohashi,' 'Gojo-ohashi' and 'Shichijo-ohashi.'
sen.cmt: aren't→are notShijou→ShijoShichijou→Shichijothey're→they are原文の「」にあわせて"を'にスペース削除

sen.j: または、かつて京阪電車が地上を走っていたころからバス停留所の名前として使われた「三条京阪」や「四条京阪前」などという呼び名も地名として親しまれている。
sen.e: Or the names “Sanjo Keihan” or “Shijo Keihann-mae” that have been used for bus stops since the days when Keihan electric Railways ran on the ground still remain familiar as the place name.
Or the names “Sanjo Keihan” or “Shijo Keihann-mae,” which have been used for bus stops since the days when Keihan Electric Railways ran on the ground, remain familiar as place names.
However, the names 'Sanjo Keihan' or 'Shijo Keihan-mae,' which have been used for bus stops since the days when Keihan Electric Railways ran on the ground, remain familiar as place names.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」にあわせて"を'にKeihann→Keihan

sen.j: 塩小路通以北の鴨川沿いには遊歩道が設けられている。
sen.e: North from Shiokoji-dori Street, a promenade has been laid along the Kamogawa River.
North from Shiokoji-dori Street, a promenade has been established along the Kamogawa River.
North from Shiokoji-dori Street, a promenade has been established along the Kamo-gawa River.

sen.j: 上側が北側、下側が南側。
sen.e: North is upper and south is lower.
North is upper, and south is lower.
North is upper, and south is lower.

sen.j: 左側が西側、右側が東側。
sen.e: West and left and east is right.
West and to the left, and east is to the right.
West and to the left, and east is to the right.

sen.j: 交差する道路の特記がないものは市町村道。
sen.e: Roads unless specified are operated by local municipalities.
Roads are operated by local municipalities unless otherwise indicated.
Roads are operated by local municipalities unless otherwise indicated.
